parseEquExpression

public static int parseEquExpression(java.lang.String expr,
                                     Program prog,
                                     int addr)
                              throws ExpressionParser.BadFormatException,
                                     ExpressionParser.BadAsteriskException,
                                     java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
 Procedure Name: parse
 Description: Parse an expression, for a DM or FM field
 
 Specification reference code(s): EX1,EX2,EX3
 Calling Sequence: (pass 1, pass 2, or both) both
 
 Error Conditions Tested: Expression syntax, undefined symbols
 Error messages generated: 202,207,213,214,218,221
 
 Modification Log (who when and why):
 Coding standards met: Signed by
 Testing standards met: Signed by

Parameters:
expr - An expression to parse
prog - A program object, used mainly for its symbol table
addr - The value of the LC at the time the equate was defined, ie the value of *
Returns:
The parsed value of the expression
Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - If something that appears to be a number cannnot be parsed
java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - In case of an undefined symbol
ExpressionParser.BadAsteriskException - If an asterisk appears outside of the first term
ExpressionParser.BadFormatException - If the expression is malformed
Since:
Apr 17, 2012

parseOperandExpression

public static int parseOperandExpression(java.lang.String expr,
                                         Program prog,
                                         Line line)
                                  throws ExpressionParser.BadFormatException,
                                         ExpressionParser.BadAsteriskException,
                                         java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                         java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
 Procedure Name: parseOperandExpression
 Description: Parse an operand expression, as might appear with a MOVD or similar instruction.
 The expression must either (1) start with an asterisk, optionally followed by a + or - then a number,
 or (2) start with a number, with or without a sign.  No other formats are allowed.
 
 Specification reference code(s): EX1
 Calling Sequence: (pass 1, pass 2, or both) pass2
 
 Error Conditions Tested:
 Error messages generated:
 
 Modification Log (who when and why): Andrew, 7 May, Start implementation
 Coding standards met: Signed by
 Testing standards met: Signed by

Parameters:
expr - An expression to parse
prog - A reference to current program object
addr - The value of the current LC; ie, the value of *
Returns:
The value of the evaluated expression
Throws:
ExpressionParser.BadFormatException - If there is a format error
java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
java.lang.NumberFormatException
ExpressionParser.BadAsteriskException
Since:
May 6, 2012

 Procedure Name: parseAdrcExpression
 Description:
 
 Specification reference code(s):
 Calling Sequence: (pass 1, pass 2, or both)
 ption: contains the abstract state for a program.
 
 Error Conditions Tested:
 Error messages generated:
 
 Modification Log (who when and why):
 Coding standards met: Signed by
 Testing standards met: Signed by

Parameters:
exprk - An ADRC expression to parse
prog - A program object, to resolve local labels and equates
line - A line object, to query for the current LC and populate with results
Returns:
The constant part of the expression (ie, the sum of the LCs of the local labels and any constants)
